ygData.subject: Re: Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
ygData.msgSnippet: It hass been that way since lvl 35 when I first went to the live tower ... ______________________________________________________ Get Your Private, Free Email
ygData.messageBody:
It hass been that way since lvl 35 when I first went to the live tower


>From: "Dark" <jackal@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
>Date: Tue, 11 Jan 2000 23:15:27 -0500
>
>Yah but at 50 you have to be in the same spot for a longer period of time
>to
>agro some mobs. Like the gargs in guk my 50 necro when heading for live
>side
>just walks by them without getting attacked.
>
>Naeeldar
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jerry Luttrell <tinarin@...>
>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Date: Tuesday, January 11, 2000 10:52 PM
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
>
>
> >From: "Jerry Luttrell" <tinarin@...>
> >
> >I have a lvl 50 dark elf necro and I have gone invis to undead and walked
> >into the gibs spawn to the point I was in one's face. They didn't attact.
>I
> >have only been attacked by them once and that was when I trained a vamp
>bat
> >into them... D'oh..
> >
> >Klayan Deathbringer lvl 50 nec
> >Celantra lvl 10 Bard Twink
> >"The Unforgiven"
> >
> >
> >>From: kim@...
> >>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >>To: eqbards@onelist.com
> >>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Possible reason invisibility fails sometimes
> >>Date: Tue, 11 Jan 2000 16:42:42 -0500 (EST)
> >>
> >>On Thu, 6 Jan 2000, Rokenn Swiftsong wrote:
> >> > >
> >> > >Heh, Gibs see invis to undead. Period. =)
> >> > >
> >> >
> >> > I would not be to sure of that, I have never had the Gibs aggro on me
> >>while
> >> > ITU'd.
> >>
> >>GIBs have always /conned ready to attack with invis to undead
> >>on me. A L50 cleric I was grouped with once said they /conned
> >>ready to attack to her with her invis to undead too.
> >>
> >>If you stick to the wall, they will not attack. There's also
> >>a chance they won't "see" you if you run by really quickly
> >>(which is what I did by accident my first time, and what got
> >>me killed my second time when I tried it again :). See
> >>Kitasi's posts on how aggro checks might be pulsed instead of
> >>continuous. (I also have a theory on this, but I'm not going
> >>to post it since it may be abusable - need to test it and send
> >>it to Verant.)
> >>
> >>--
> >>John H. Kim
> >>kim@...
> >>
> >>
> >
